analysis.narrative:
ðŸ“Š **Consensus:** Mixed-to-cautious sentiment with low-to-medium conviction. X/Twitter and RSS sources highlight near-term technical weakness and policy headwinds despite bullish seasonality expectations, while quantitative sentiment readings remain broadly bullish (62-100% across sources). The disconnect between narrative caution and sentiment optimism suggests a market at an inflection point.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** Rate policy uncertainty and higher-for-longer expectations weighing on valuations; AI/tech sector momentum facing technical deterioration signals in mega-caps; sector rotation toward defensive positioning and precious metals as risk-off hedges; holiday seasonality dynamics with Santa Rally thesis being tested.

ðŸŽ¯ **Levels:** SPY ($690.38): Call Wall $700 (150k OI) - ACTIVE resistance 1.4% away, Put Wall $640 (153k OI) - dormant support 7.3% away. Max Pain $684. Near support: $645 (125k OI), $650 (41k OI). QQQ ($623.93): Call Wall $640 (31k OI) - ACTIVE resistance 2.6% away, near resistance $630 (30k OI) - ACTIVE at 1.0% away, Put Wall $590 (164k OI) - dormant support 5.4% away. Max Pain $617. Net bias on both: BULLISH_SUPPORT from dealer positioning.
key_themes: Rate policy uncertainty and higher-for-longer expectations
Sector rotation toward defensives and precious metals
Holiday seasonality and Santa Rally thesis under scrutiny
Fintech and enterprise software earnings weakness contagion risk
risk_factors: Technical weakness in mega-cap tech contradicting bullish fundamentals
January rate cut odds at only 12% constraining valuations
Geopolitical tensions in Taiwan and Ukraine driving risk-off flows
Regulatory tightening across fintech and pharmaceuticals
Sentiment extremes suggesting potential distribution opportunity on bounces
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: $700 call wall resistance (active), gravitational pull toward $684 max pain. QQQ: $630 near resistance (active), $640 call wall above, $617 max pain anchor
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: $700 resistance ceiling, $645-$650 support zone if weakness develops, $640 put wall major floor. QQQ: $640 resistance cap, $590 put wall major support if pullback extends
